info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 15 at 3:15PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Schenectady, northwestern Albany and northeastern Schoharie Counties through 345 PM EDT... At 314 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Schoharie, or 12 miles east of Cobleskill, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Berne, Voorheesville, Altamont, Schoharie, Delanson, Central Bridge, New Scotland, Knox, Duane, Meadowdale, Old Central Bridge, Old Stone Fort, Quaker Street, Dunnsville, New Salem, Hartmans Corners, Fort Hunter, Sidney Corners, West Township and Fullers. This includes Interstate 88 near exit 23. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
